txt.en:
'Menem-nar was one of Khazad-dûm's most productive mithril veins. The metal ran far and deep in large amounts throughout the caverns. It was a great surprise for a vein of its depth.

'If Khazad-dûm is to return to its former glory, finding and mining new sources of mithril is necessary. However, mining the deeps is dangerous and expensive. If we can find a vein in a safer area it would do much towards helping us reclaim the depths from the Orcs.

'Return south to Menem-nar and sample several of the rocks you find inside. Bring back what you collect, and I shall study it to see if there are any traces of the mithril-vein left. You may wish to bring an ally or two, for it has been long since Menem-nar was controlled by dwarves.'
'These samples are perfect, [placeholder]. I will begin studying them at once. Hopefully one will contain at least a trace of mithril, then we can begin mining Menem-nar once more.'
'If we can find a reliable source of mithril, we can quickly retake the deeps.'
HIDING CONTENT - DNT - Menem-nar: Veins of Mithril
Menem-nar is an ancient mine where much mithril was dug from. The dwarves believe it may still hold more.

Menem-nar is to the south of the Deep Descent.\n\nStyrr asked you to venture into Menem-nar and gather up several rock samples so he can determine if there is still mithril behind the hidden dwarf-door. He recommended you bring an ally or two.
Bring the rocks to Styrr at the Deep Descent
Styrr is at the Deep Descent, north of Menem-nar.\n\nStyrr will want to begin examining the samples you brought out of Menem-nar.
